content.user_title: Build interactive HTML artifacts with React
content.value_statement: Creating complex HTML artifacts for Claude conversations requires modern frontend tooling. This skill provides automated project setup with React, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui components. It bundles everything into a single self-contained HTML file ready for artifact display.
actual_capabilities: Initialize a React + TypeScript project with Vite in one command
Install and configure 40+ shadcn/ui components including dialogs, forms, and data displays
Bundle React applications into a single self-contained HTML file
Configure path aliases and Tailwind CSS theming for consistent styling
Support dark mode and CSS variables for theming
Create production builds without source maps for artifact sharing
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher to run build scripts
Not suitable for simple single-file HTML or JSX artifacts
Generated artifacts require internet connection for shadcn/ui dependencies
Cannot create artifacts that interact with external APIs during runtime

use_cases.title: Create rich interactive demos
use_cases.description: Build complex interactive demonstrations with React components for coding tutorials and documentation.

use_cases.title: Build learning dashboards
use_cases.description: Create educational dashboards with charts, tables, and form components to visualize learning progress.

use_cases.title: Prototype UI components
use_cases.description: Design and prototype user interface components with accessible Radix UI primitives and Tailwind styling.

prompt_templates.title: Initialize project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the web-artifacts-builder skill to create a new project called [project-name]. Then install and configure the following shadcn/ui components: button, card, dialog, and form.

prompt_templates.title: Build interactive component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React artifact with a responsive navigation menu, a data table showing sample products, and a dialog for editing item details. Use shadcn/ui components.

prompt_templates.title: Bundle final artifact
prompt_templates.prompt: Bundle the current React application into a single HTML file using the web-artifacts-builder skill. The output should be ready to share as a Claude artifact.

prompt_templates.title: Add data visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an artifact that displays interactive charts using shadcn/ui components. Include a bar chart showing monthly metrics and a pie chart for category distribution. Style with Tailwind CSS.

output_examples.input: Create a React artifact with a task management interface including a Kanban board with drag-and-drop cards, filters by status and priority, and a form to add new tasks.
output: Installed components: card, dialog, form, input, select, tabs, draggable panels
Created Kanban board layout with three columns (todo, in-progress, done)
Added filter controls for status and priority dropdowns
Built new task form with validation using React Hook Form + Zod

best_practices: Initialize projects with unique names to avoid conflicts when running multiple artifacts
Test artifacts locally by opening bundle.html in a browser before sharing
Remove unused shadcn components to reduce final bundle size
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill for simple single-file HTML or JSX artifacts
Avoid excessive centered layouts and purple gradients to prevent visual clutter
Do not skip the bundling step when sharing artifacts with Claude users

faq.question: What versions of Node.js are supported?
faq.answer: Node.js 18 or higher is required. The skill auto-detects the version and pins Vite to 5.4.11 for Node 18 compatibility.

faq.question: How many shadcn/ui components are included?
faq.answer: Over 40 pre-installed components including accordion, alert, calendar, card, carousel, dialog, dropdown-menu, form, select, table, tabs, toast, and more.

faq.question: Can I integrate external APIs in artifacts?
faq.answer: Artifacts run in browser context and can fetch data from APIs. However, bundled artifacts include all dependencies inline for offline compatibility.

faq.question: Is user data safe in artifacts?
faq.answer: Artifacts run entirely in the user's browser. No data is sent to external servers during runtime. All state remains local.

faq.question: Why is my bundle size large?
faq.answer: Larger bundles occur when using many components or large dependencies. Remove unused imports and consider lazy loading for complex features.

faq.question: How does this differ from writing HTML directly?
faq.answer: This skill enables React development patterns including components, state management, and hooks. Better for complex interactive UIs than raw HTML.
